summary: The contact owns a 2014 Stellar Eclipse Fifth Wheel Trailer. The contact stated that while in for routine maintenance, it was discovered that the subframe had severe rusting and corrosion which had caused multiple holes in the spring rails of the suspension. The vehicle was not yet repaired. The manufacturer and local dealer were not notified of the failure. The approximate failure mileage was 18,000. Consumer stated there are two identification numbers.*JB

EVERY PLACE THERE WAS SOMETHING WELDED TO THE I BEAM THE I BEAM HAS CRACKED AND BROKEN ALL THE WAY THREW IN SEVERAL PLACES. THE LEAF SPRING HANGERS ARE LEANING SIDEWAYS AND THE I BEAM IS ACTUALLY WRINKLED LOOKING. THE CROSS SUPPORT HAS ALSO BROKEN LOOSE.  THE FIFTH WHEEL WAS STATIONARY WHEN THESE CRACKS HAPPENED WITH ONLY 1000 LBS OR SO STORED IN IT. WHEN THE FIFTH WHEEL IS MOVED THE REAR AXLE SHIFTS SIDE TO SIDE AND MAKES LOUD CREAKING SOUNDS.
